About Me

Hi! I am a Computer Science Master's student at Cal Poly SLO (aka California Polytechnic State University, San Luis Obispo). I specialize in Deep Learning, particularly applications in Earth and Atmospheric Sciences. My passions for programming, music, and the environment often intertwine in my projects. Click below to learn more!

Experience

DeepTCR: Tropical Cyclone Rainfall Forecasting @ PNNL

Developing a physics-inspired deep learning architecture for hurricane rainfall forecasting, outperforming state-of-the-art numerical models. Work is continuing as a funded project.

SULI 2021: Sea Surface Temperature Forecasting

Researching physics-informed machine learning approaches to sea-surface temperature, utilizing Koopman operator theory and autoencoders. Lead author on resulting research paper.
